Differential Equations | Variation of Parameters.

variation of parameters\n[imath]\begin{array}{c}\n\boldsymbol{y}^{\prime \prime}+\boldsymbol{p}(\boldsymbol{x}) \boldsymbol{y}^{\prime}+\boldsymbol{q}(\boldsymbol{x}) \boldsymbol{y}=\boldsymbol{g}(\boldsymbol{x}) \\\n\boldsymbol{y}_{1} \int_{\boldsymbol{x}_{0}}^{\boldsymbol{x}} \frac{\boldsymbol{y}_{2}(\boldsymbol{t}) \boldsymbol{g}(\boldsymbol{t})}{\boldsymbol{W}(\boldsymbol{t})} d t\n\end{array}[/imath][imath]\boldsymbol{y}^{\prime \prime}+\boldsymbol{p}(\boldsymbol{x}) \boldsymbol{y}^{\prime}+\boldsymbol{q}(\boldsymbol{x}) \boldsymbol{y}=\boldsymbol{g}(\boldsymbol{x}) [/imath] [imath]\boldsymbol{y}_{1} \int_{\boldsymbol{x}_{0}}^{\boldsymbol{x}} \frac{\boldsymbol{y}_{2}(\boldsymbol{t}) \boldsymbol{g}(\boldsymbol{t})}{\boldsymbol{W}(\boldsymbol{t})} d t[/imath]
